Description: Rim sherd of North Ionian Late Wild Goat Style black-figured pottery bowl; pale slip; interior: painted black with traces added red band lined in white near centre of sherd; exterior: below plain rim, black-figure animal frieze: of lion (part of head and one hind leg missing) to left following goat or deer (part of hind leg); pin wheel rosette, dot rosettes, four petalled rosettes and dashes as filling ornament; below, wide black band; below, animal frieze with goat (part of one antler remaining) to left; part of undetermined filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by City Art Gallery and Museum, Bristol. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.239)
